reqs:
Pre-reqs: One of APSC 176, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121.
Co-reqs: APSC 201.
Special note: The course commences on Monday, August 21 (not August 22, as stated above) for some students, and on Thursday, September 7 for other students. For further information, please see CIVL 201 requirements
http://www.civil.ubc.ca/academic-programs/undergraduate-program/civl-201-requirements
Last day to withdraw without a W standing is Sept 19, 2017 Last day to withdraw with W standing is October 14, 2017
Do NOT contact the professor regarding registration problems.
If the course is full, please fill out the online course registration form available at the below web link http://www.civil.ubc.ca/webform/course-request-registration-form and submit it electronically.
Please check back regularly to see if space opens up in the class. All applications requesting admission to the course will be considered in August. Priority will be given to students requiring the course as a core component to their program and to Civil Engineering students requesting the course as a technical elective (if applicable). You will be advised in August if you have been admitted to the class or not.
description: The design process; graphical, visualization and computational tools; civil engineering disciplines; decision-making; teamwork; conceptual design project reflecting community, economic, environmental, sustainability and technical considerations.
